Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of a Standardized Operating Procedure and Educational Program on Adherence to Intraoperative Lung Protective Ventilation

Trial_Design.evidence: unit of randomisation stated; Randomization and blinding were not applicable.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included adult patients scheduled for non-thoracic surgery. Conducted at Masaryk Hospital, Czech Republic, from April 20 to July 18, 2023

Intervention.evidence: The intervention comprised an SOP and a mandatory educational program.

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the impact of a standardized operating procedure (SOP) enhanced with an educational program on adherence to intraoperative lung protective ventilation (IOLPV).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was adherence to the IOLPV bundle, assessed over one month pre- and post-intervention.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization and blinding were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Randomization and blinding were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 164 patients were analyzed (Group A: 82 pre-intervention, Group B: 82 post-intervention).

Number_Analysed.evidence: 164 patients were analyzed (Group A: 82 pre-intervention, Group B: 82 post-intervention).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Adherence to the IOLPV bundle significantly increased in Group B (Group A: 4%, Group B: 24%; p < 0.001).
